title: VC Zarechye Odintsovo
text:
Zarechye-Odintsovo () is a Russian women's <a href="volleyball">volleyball</a> club based in <a href="Odintsovo">Odintsovo</a>. The club was founded in 1987 and plays in the <a href="Russian%20Women%27s%20Volleyball%20Super%20League">super league</a>, the top Russian league.
History.
The club was established in 1987. The first title came in 1995, with the Russian Cup. Five more cups were added with victories in 2002, 2003, 2004, 2006 and 2007. The first <a href="Russian%20Women%27s%20Volleyball%20Super%20League">Russian Super League</a> title came in 2007–08 and the second in 2009–10. In European competitions, the club was runner-up of the <a href="CEV%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League">CEV Champions League</a> in the <a href="2007%E2%80%9308%20CEV%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League">2007–08 edition</a>, losing the final against <a href="Pallavolo%20Sirio%20Perugia">Despar Colussi Perugia</a>. The team won its first European competition in 2013–14 at the <a href="CEV%20Women%27s%20Challenge%20Cup">CEV Challenge Cup</a>, beating <a href="Be%C5%9Fikta%C5%9F%20Women%27s%20Volleyball%20Team">Beşiktaş</a> in the final.
Team Roster.
Season 2018–2019
